outputs.output_descr:
Tamil nadu and Kerala have evidence-based  inputs to the policy by September 2008, to strategically ensure sustainable livelihoods for coastal marginal fisher folk in tsunami affected areas, through Fisheries co management models, and strategies for enhancing and diversifying  fisheries livelihoods.

Target women groups and youth in the tsunami affected areas of Kanyakumari and Kollam districts have increased their incomes by gaining employment in Non-Fishing sector by the end of 2008.
Continued commitment to social equity issues in UNTRS programmes and initiatives and the general post tsunami R & R activities.

Plans for the long-term conservation of unique coastal eco-systems of tsunami affected areas in mainland southern India (Tsunami affected states and Union Territory) for their environmental services are developed by end 2008.

a)Sustainable and replicable  model established to enhance information sharing for better coordination amongst stakeholders  for relief, recovery and rehabilitation to disasters.                             
b) Capacities of the Government of Tamil Nadu and CSOs to coordinate with eachother and manage response to disasters strengthened.
Community workers, Government relief workers and trainers trained in psychosocial care and support. Most affected communities identified and supported.

Tamil nadu and Kerala have evidence-based  inputs to the policy by September 2008, to strategically ensure sustainable livelihoods for coastal marginal fisher folk in tsunami affected areas, through Fisheries co management models, and strategies for enhancing and diversifying  fisheries livelihoods.

Target women groups and youth in the tsunami affected areas of Kanyakumari and Kollam districts have increased their incomes by gaining employment in Non-Fishing sector by the end of 2008.

project_descr: United Nations recovery framework in support of Government of India for a post-tsunami rehabilitation and reconstruction programme.
